result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L Rueden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1 day jail credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed necessary.

No contact with P.B. or Quality Roofing premises.

records.addlTxt: 8:49 Defendant Daniel L Rueden in court with attorney David R. Dickmann.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:04 Defendant Daniel L Rueden in court with attorney David Dickmann.  Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Caleb Bornbach is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Dominguez. He is a police officer with the Marshfield Police Department. On 8/8/14, a call was received regarding unauthorized transactions on an employer gas card. There were 13 unauthorized transactions between 5/1/14 and 7/31/14. Video was obtained from a gas station in Marshfield, Wood County, where a license plate number was obtained that came back to a vehicle belonging to defendant. Defendant was a prior employee. Derek Dominguez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Attorney Dickmann cross-examines witness. 
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 05-08-2015 11:00 am
The court orders the defendant to have his fingerprints taken at MFPD
The court orders the defendant to have his fingerprints taken at MFPD
Defendant Daniel L Rueden in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bound over for further proceedings.
